message.content:
cs.CL, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.IR, cs.NE 

This paper is likely to belong to the arXiv CS sub-category of Natural Language Processing (cs.CL) as it proposes a method for measuring the salience of words, which is an essential step in numerous NLP tasks. The paper also uses pre-trained word embeddings, which are commonly used in NLP. 

The paper also involves machine learning, specifically learning word salience scores, which suggests that it could also belong to the sub-categories of Machine Learning (cs.LG) and Artificial Intelligence (cs.AI). 

The paper's focus on predicting words in sentences based on the words that appear in the sentences preceding or succeeding that sentence suggests that it could also belong to the sub-category of Information Retrieval (cs.IR). 

Finally, the paper's use of neural networks to learn word salience scores suggests that it could also belong to the sub-category of Neural Networks (cs.NE).
